tool_description: Wit is a natural language interface for applications capable of turning sentences into structured data. The Wit API allows HTTP GET calls returning the extracted meaning from a given sentence based on examples.
name: Wit.ai
title: Wit.ai

api_list.name: message
api_list.description: Returns the extracted meaning from a sentence, based on instance data.

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description: User’s query. Length must be > 0 and < 256

optional_parameters.name: msg_id
optional_parameters.description: A specific Id you want to assign to the message that will be processed. If not set, Wit.AI will auto generate one for you

optional_parameters.name: n
optional_parameters.description: The number of n-best outcomes you want to get back. default is 1

api_list.name: Entities list
api_list.description: Returns a list of available entities for the instance.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://baskarm28-wit-ai-v1.p.rapidapi.com/entities"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "baskarm28-wit-ai-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://baskarm28-wit-ai-v1.p.rapidapi.com/entities"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "baskarm28-wit-ai-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Corresponding intent
api_list.description: Returns the corresponding intent with all its entities and expressions.

api_list.name: Extract meaning
api_list.description: Returns the extracted meaning from a sentence, based on instance data.

api_list.name: Message id
api_list.description: Returns the stored message for a specific id.

api_list.name: Audio file meaning
api_list.description: Returns the meaning extracted from an audio file or stream.

optional_parameters.name: msg_id
optional_parameters.description: A specific Id you want to assign to the message that will be processed. If not set, Wit.AI will auto generate one for you

optional_parameters.name: n
optional_parameters.description: The number of n-best outcomes you want to get back. default is 1

api_list.name: Intents list
api_list.description: Returns a list of all intents (without their expressions).
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://baskarm28-wit-ai-v1.p.rapidapi.com/intents"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "baskarm28-wit-ai-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
